result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Cedric Montreal McCottry in court.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense counsel has not been appointed as of today's date. Court scheduled an additional status of counsel hearing date. Case adjourned to Branch 45.
  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cedric Montreal McCottry in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has filed a motion to withdraw as counsel of record. Court grants motion and refers Defendant to the State Public Defender's Office. Plea and sentencing date of 06/30/2022 is vacated. Case is adjourned in Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court in receipt of a motion to withdraw from defense counsel. Court scheduled via email correspondence with parties a motion hearing date. A motion to withdraw hearing date has been scheduled fr June 2nd, 2022, at 10:30 am IN PERSON.
